name: Linter Cop Rules - Infos not fixed
description: Rules that we have decided to keep as Info to enforce them for new code, but we have not yet fixed all legacy code to comply with them.

rules.justification: Commit() needs a comment to justify its existence. Either a leading or a trailing comment.
Show warning about code metrics for each function or trigger if either cyclomatic complexity is 8 or greater or maintainability index 20 or lower.
Always provide fieldsgroups DropDown and Brick on tables.
Procedure must be either local, internal or define a documentation comment. ~ Related to LC0072.
ToolTip must end with a dot.
ToolTip must start with the verb "Specifies".
Do not use line breaks in ToolTip.
Try to not exceed 200 characters (including spaces).
Explicitly set the RunTrigger parameter on build-in methods. ~ Being explicit is better than being implicit.
Informs the user that there are missing permission to access tabledata. ~ Set indirect permissions in code to allow the user to run the code with indirect permissions.
Empty statements should be avoided or should have a leading or trailing comment explaining their use. Set to Info as it seems to be unstable.
The documentation comment must match the procedure syntax. ~ Related to LC0025.
Temporary records should not trigger table triggers. ~ Set to Info to raise awareness in new code. We can not always avoid it, but we should be aware of it.
Use Rec.IsEmpty() for checking record existence. ~ Performance.
Consider using a Query or Rec.Find('-') with Rec.Next(). ~ Performance.
Show Cognitive Complexity diagnostics for methods above threshold. ~ Helps to keep code maintainable.
